topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 2.1: Administer Your Cloud Using the HCG Dashboard

body.section:
The HCG-Dashboard is a cloud management tool which allows users to Define, Deploy, Manage and Monitor the cloud.
The HCG-Dashboard allows users to provide and validate the cloud definitions required to define a cloud through a web interface.
Once the cloud is defined user will be able guided through various stages of deployment
After the cloud is deployed, user will be able to perform various post deployment activities as Service resets, patching and upgrade.

Features Available Today
Use the "Cloud Input" wizard on the UI to:
Specify the Cloud Name
Specify KVM Servers info and Map the KVM servers to the Controllers
In the KVM servers get validated for connectivity and credentials correctness.
Specify Network information for all 5 types of networks (CLM, API, BLS) (If you do not have Segment IDs, Enter -1)
View validation results of network information provided (Validation for API and BLS networks not part of 2.1 but will be added for 2.1 GA)
Specify all variables
View validation results of DNS Server IP and NTP Server IP (There is a known cosmetic bug for the results of this validation, will be fixed in upcoming builds)
Click Finish to save all this data into your clouds json files.
By default, RCP template is used to create the cloud definitions.
Use the "Deploy Cloud" wizard on the UI to (More details below):
Provision the Nodes (equivalent to hlm provision)
Generate the cloud configuration from jsons (equivalent to hlm generate)
Network Initialize the cloud nodes (equivalent to hlm netinit)
Deploy the cloud nodes (equivalent to hlm deploy)
Use the "Manage Cloud" wizard on the UI to:
Reset service including - MySQL, RabbitMQ, NTP, Apache, Keystone, Glance, Swift, Cinder, Elastic Search, Logstash, Kibana, Beaver, Icinga and Attis Note: You cannot edit an existing cloud definition for the KVM region compute servers (Inventory Nodes).
